ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A broad knowledge of Italian literature and culture throughout the past few centuries.

I gained a foundation in Italian literature from the Baroque period to modern-day. Got some good practice writing, through the comprehension assignments and short papers, as well as speaking, through class discussions and student presentations.

After taking this course, I have now read pieces from all of Italy's main authors from the Baroque to the Present. I have learned to analyze their pieces and connect them amongst each other. After this course, one can have a conversation with any Italian about their most famed authors.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Simona always has a great class planned. The daily presentations are a good way to break up the class every day as well as interesting.
Everything about this course is strong. I am amazed at how much I have learned from Simona in this course.
Strengths: fun discussions, fun readings, everything was amazing! Simona is an amazing instructor.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely, the Italian department is the best with amazing professors as well as a truly enjoyable experience in every course.

Yes, I highly recommend this course. If you are considering whether to take this or an L5 Italian course with a lighter workload, absolutely take this one. It holds you to a high standard and you definitely must prepare the reading well before class, but it is never very long and Simona picks great selections. The foundation it has given me in Italian literature is invaluable. This course includes a great balance of speaking, reading, writing, and listening. I think this course would be great on its own but I'm glad I took the Duecento to the Renaissance course first as it gave me historical context.
Yes! If you want to learn about Italian literature at a broad spectrum, this is the perfect course! Simona is also so well versed in the content, and also the sweetest professor out there.
